body: Should be easy enough. To avoid locale controversies I suggest a simple half width space.

What do you think about limiting the displayed numbers to 4 digits, using prefixes (e.g. here ~312k files ~46k dirs ~1009 GiB) and displaying the exact number in a tooltip? I'd think that the latter digits aren't relevant anymore in general with such high counts (and for debugging there is the tooltip).

> To avoid locale controversies

Would it not be _better_ displayed as locale specific?

I agree with @kalsan, please don't limit the digits. 
Also `.` would be the (another) correct separator for the EU. 
I think we could get away with just a space or a field where people could enter what they want.
JavaScript numbers have the `.toLocaleString([locale])` method. We should use that.
If you're going to localeify things, note all the other numbers as well: sizes, percentages and so on.

> Also . would be the (another) correct separator for the EU.

@uok Not in Switzerland AFAIK :rofl: I overly simplified when I wrote "EU", things are much more complicated than that I'm afraid. We should be happy there is no imperial Kilobyte.

Switzerland isn't in the EU, so...

I am ruing having started the bike shedding. Lets remember calmh's first foresighted comment:

 > Should be easy enough. To avoid locale controversies I suggest a simple half width space.
A space or a half width space follows the international conventions introduced in 2003 and IMHO would be the best option (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_separator#Current_standards and f.)

+1 on use of a partial-width space, both `.` and `,` are used in at least some locales as a decimal separator, so they should be avoided for use for digit grouping if you're not going to be localizing it.

Ideally, it would be some form of space that prevents a line break, but the only options I know of that might work are U+00A0 (no-break space) and U+202F (narrow no-break space).  The first one is full-width, and the second doesn't have a consistent width across font-families (and is usually different from a half-width space).

rename.to: Thousand separator for numbers in GUI
